item.title: Microsoft leads shift beyond data unification to organization, delivering next-gen AI readiness with new Microsoft Fabric capabilities - The Official Microsoft Blog
item.description: We’re in a hinge moment for AI. The experiments are over and the real work has begun. Centralizing data, once the finish line, is now the starting point. The definition of “AI readiness” is evolving as increasingly sophisticated agents demand rich, contextualized data grounded in business operations to deliver meaningful results. What sets leaders apart...

item.title: Reaching Across the Isles: UK-LLM Brings AI to UK Languages With NVIDIA Nemotron
item.description: Trained on the Isambard-AI supercomputer, UK-LLM enables AI reasoning for Welsh and other UK languages for public services.

item.title: A joint statement from Microsoft and OpenAI - The Official Microsoft Blog
item.description: Microsoft and OpenAI have signed a non-binding memorandum of understanding (MOU) for the next phase of our partnership. We are actively working to finalize contractual terms in a definitive agreement. Together, we remain focused on delivering the best AI tools for everyone, grounded in our shared commitment to safety.

item.title: Five Years On, Reels Reigns as India's Top Short-Form Video Platform
item.description: Findings from a new Meta-commissioned IPSOS study show that Reels across our platforms is India’s top driver of daily video consumption ahead of other surveyed platforms.

item.title: Flexible work update - The Official Microsoft Blog
item.description: Amy Coleman, Executive Vice President and Chief People Officer, shared the below communication with Microsoft employees this morning. How we work has forever changed. I remember starting at Microsoft in the late ‘90s, always in the office, no laptops, and primarily working with the people right down the hall. As technology evolved and our business expanded, we became...

item.title: NVIDIA Partners With AI Infrastructure Ecosystem to Unveil Reference Design for Giga-Scale AI Factories
item.description: At this week’s AI Infrastructure Summit in Silicon Valley, NVIDIA’s VP of Accelerated Computing Ian Buck unveiled a bold new vision: the transformation of traditional data centers into fully integrated AI factories. As part of this initiative, NVIDIA is developing reference designs to be shared with partners and enterprises worldwide — offering an NVIDIA Omniverse Read Article

item.title: Now Live: Europe’s First Exascale Supercomputer, JUPITER, Accelerates Climate Research, Neuroscience, Quantum Simulation
item.description: At JUPITER’s inauguration ceremony in Jülich, attended by Germany Chancellor Friedrich Merz, the Jülich Supercomputing Centre and NVIDIA unveiled ways the supercomputer is already spurring innovation across the world.

item.title: Attach Text to Your Threads Posts and Share Longer Perspectives
item.description: We're rolling out a way for you to attach up to 10,000 characters of text to a Threads post.

item.title: Instagram Launches A Microdrama Series To Encourage Gen Z To Take Creative Chances
item.description: Today, Instagram released a microdrama series in India to inspire Gen Z to take creative risks and bring them together. Titled ‘Party of Two’, the series follows Instagram’s ‘Anyway’ campaign from this year.

item.title: Meta’s Kansas City Data Center and Upcoming AI-Optimized Data Centers
item.description: Our Kansas City data center is now operational, representing a $1 billion investment in Missouri and in our global infrastructure that brings our technologies to billions of people worldwide.

item.title: New Instagram Features to Help You Connect
item.description: We’re launching features that make it easier to connect with your friends on Instagram.

item.title: Personal Superintelligence for Everyone
item.description: Today, Meta Founder & CEO Mark Zuckerberg shared his vision to bring personal superintelligence to everyone.

item.title: Score big with Prime for Young Adults—Amazon’s discounted Prime membership
item.description: Learn about the extraordinary value of the go-to Prime membership for 18-to-24-year-olds. Eligible new members can try it for six months for $0 and earn 5% cash back.

item.title: You Can Now Edit Videos With Meta AI
item.description: We’re launching a generative AI video editing feature across the Meta AI app, the Meta.AI website and the Edits app to help you bring your creative ideas to life.

item.title: Kuiper mission updates: Kuiper constellation grows to more than 100 satellites
item.description: Follow along for updates as Project Kuiper launches more than 80 missions to deploy our initial low Earth orbit satellite internet constellation.

item.title: AlphaQubit tackles one of quantum computing’s biggest challenges
item.description: AlphaQubit is an AI-based decoder that identifies quantum computing errors with state-of-the-art accuracy.

item.title: Is a Prime membership worth it? The short answer is yes.
item.description: Here are all the perks and benefits that make a Prime membership well worth the cost.

item.title: 7 Prime benefits that will save you money
item.description: It’s not just about free shipping and Prime Video. Prime keeps money back in your pocket.

item.title: 5 awesome benefits that make your Prime membership worth it
item.description: A Prime membership has a lot to offer. Here are just a few of the best benefits in time for Prime Big Deal Days this October.

item.title: NVIDIA Unveils Rubin CPX: A New Class of GPU Designed for Massive-Context Inference
item.description: NVIDIA® today announced NVIDIA Rubin CPX, a new class of GPU purpose-built for massive-context processing. This enables AI systems to handle million-token software coding and generative video with groundbreaking speed and efficiency.

item.title: NVIDIA Announces Financial Results for Second Quarter Fiscal 2026
item.description: NVIDIA (NASDAQ: NVDA) today reported revenue for the second quarter ended July 27, 2025, of $46.7 billion, up 6% from the previous quarter and up 56% from a year ago. NVIDIA’s Blackwell Data Center revenue grew 17% sequentially.

item.title: Industry Leaders Transform Enterprise Data Centers for the AI Era With NVIDIA RTX PRO Servers
item.description: NVIDIA today announced leading global enterprises have adopted NVIDIA RTX PRO™ Servers — a new category of enterprise data center infrastructure powered by the RTX PRO 6000 Blackwell Server Edition GPU — speeding the shift from general-purpose computing clusters to AI factory infrastructure, without a complete data center overhaul.

item.title: AlphaGenome: AI for better understanding the genome
item.description: Introducing a new, unifying DNA sequence model that advances regulatory variant-effect prediction and promises to shed new light on genome function — now available via API.

item.title: A catalogue of genetic mutations to help pinpoint the cause of diseases
item.description: New AI tool classifies the effects of 71 million ‘missense’ mutations Uncovering the root causes of disease is one of the greatest challenges in human genetics. With millions of possible...

item.title: AlphaProteo generates novel proteins for biology and health research
item.description: New AI system designs proteins that successfully bind to target molecules, with potential for advancing drug design, disease understanding and more.

item.title: AlphaEvolve: A Gemini-powered coding agent for designing advanced algorithms
item.description: New AI agent evolves algorithms for math and practical applications in computing by combining the creativity of large language models with automated evaluators

item.title: AI achieves silver-medal standard solving International Mathematical Olympiad problems

item.title: Millions of new materials discovered with deep learning
item.description: We share the discovery of 2.2 million new crystals – equivalent to nearly 800 years’ worth of knowledge. We introduce Graph Networks for Materials Exploration (GNoME), our new deep learning tool...

item.title: New Shepard NS-35 Mission Updates | Blue Origin
item.description: New Shepard NS-35 is targeting liftoff on Thursday, Sept. 18. The uncrewed payload mission will fly more than 40 scientific and research payloads to space.

item.title: Blue Alchemist Hits Major Milestone Toward Permanent and Sustainable Lunar Infrastructure | Blue Origin
item.description: Blue Origin's pioneering in-space resource utilization system, Blue Alchemist, has successfully completed its Critical Design Review, marking a transformative milestone toward humanity's permanent expansion beyond Earth.

item.title: The Mission: Blue Origin’s Mars Telecommunications Orbiter | Blue Origin
item.description: Built upon our existing and affordable Blue Ring platform, our Mars Telecommunications Orbiter is ready to support NASA’s Mars mission in 2028.

item.title: Blue Origin’s New Shepard Completes 34th Mission to Space | Blue Origin
item.description: Blue Origin successfully completed its 14th human spaceflight and the 34th flight for the New Shepard program.
